definition: road or pavement laid with flagstones
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Green stone road, slowly flow accumulation of rainwater.
sentences.chinese: 青青的石板路，緩緩流淌着積累的雨水。

sentences.english: Night, walking in the town of quartzite on the road, visitors are filled.
sentences.chinese: 晚上，走在小鎮的青石板路上，遊人摩肩接踵。

sentences.english: The main tourist paths are well illuminated and laid with bricks.
sentences.chinese: 主要的遊客通道都鋪了石板路並有很好的照明。

sentences.english: Stone road is still face a shame the lilac girl.
sentences.chinese: 青石板路上走過的依舊是面露微羞的丁香姑娘。

sentences.english: Stone Road, Ma Tau wallwatts, red lacquer beam.
sentences.chinese: 石板路，馬頭牆，青灰瓦，朱漆梁。
